result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary L. Waltemate was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office.
Concurrent with: Probation on counts 1& 3 to run concurrent to each other as are the conditions thereof unless otherwise specified.

miscConds.notes:
Fine and/or costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent. Bond of $150.00 was applied.

Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.
Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.  

The defendant shall submit to random urine/PBT testing as required by the agent or any law enforcement officer.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Prosecutor, Lyndsey A.B. Brunette, and Defendant, Zachary L. Waltemate, appeared with Attorney Christine Kuczynski. Request no contact be lifted.  Status conference scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 11:00 am.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 09:45 am.

to allow contact with J.W. for their Grandmothers funeral during the hours of 8:30AM to 2PM on Thursday June 25,2015-granted
THE DEFENDANT ENTERED A PLEA OF NOT GUILTY

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.
Defendant shall have no violent or otherwise disorderly contact with D.H.   The defendant shall have no contact with J.W. of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.
6-23-2015 AMENDED contact with J.W. for their Grandmother's funeral ONLY during the hours of 8:30AM to 2PM on Thursday June 25,2015 IS ALLOWED.
7-16-2015 Amended No contact with J.W. is amended to Defendant shall have no violent or otherwise disorderly contact
